title: Implement unique items system with 10-12 uniques
description: Create UniqueItems.ts with 10-12 build-defining unique items. Each needs: name, slot/type, base stats, uniqueEffect description, and implementation logic that modifies skill behavior or adds proc effects. GDD examples: Power Shot fires 3 arrows, Fireball leaves burning ground, Evasive Roll drops trap, Lightning Chain bounces same enemy twice, kill explosions, Teleport leaves Frost Nova. Integrate with ItemGenerator.ts unique rarity roll (1%).
notes:
## prepared.prompt

## Context
Unique items are the endgame chase items that define builds. The data structure supports uniqueEffect but no uniques are defined. This is core to replayability.

## Task
Create `src/loot/UniqueItems.ts` with 10-12 unique items and integrate with the drop system.

Define a `UNIQUE_ITEMS` array. Each unique should have:
- `name`: Memorable name
- `slot`: gear slot (weapon, armor, ring, amulet, offhand)
- `weaponType`: if weapon (bow, crossbow, wand, staff, orb, thrown)
- `baseStats`: fixed stat bonuses
- `uniqueEffect`: description string shown in tooltip
- `effectId`: string key for effect implementation

**Unique Item Definitions (from GDD + creative additions):**

Weapons:
1. **Splinterbow** (Bow) - "Power Shot fires 3 arrows in a narrow spread"
2. **Inferno Staff** (Staff) - "Fireball leaves burning ground for 3 seconds"
3. **Stormcaller Wand** (Wand) - "Lightning Chain can bounce to the same enemy twice"
4. **Voidcaster Orb** (Orb) - "Teleport leaves a Frost Nova at your departure point"

Armor:
5. **Deathweaver Vest** - "Enemies you kill explode for 10% of their max HP"
6. **Phasewalker Cloak** - "Evasive Roll drops a trap at your starting position"

Rings:
7. **Band of Echoes** - "Skills have 15% chance to not trigger cooldown"
8. **Vampiric Loop** - "Recover 2% of damage dealt as health"

Amulets:
9. **Prism of Elements** - "Status effects you apply deal 25% more damage"
10. **Heart of the Grid** - "+1 projectile to all attacks"

Offhand:
11. **Chrono Shield** - "Taking fatal damage instead heals 30% HP (60s cooldown)"
12. **Essence Conduit** - "Kills grant 3s of +20% movement and attack speed"

**Integration:**
- In `ItemGenerator.ts`: when unique rarity is rolled (1%), pick random unique from pool matching the slot being generated
- Set the item name to unique name, add uniqueEffect string
- Unique items always have gold/orange rarity color
- Effect IMPLEMENTATION can be stubbed with TODO comments - just wire the data and drop system

## Key Files
- NEW: `src/loot/UniqueItems.ts` - Unique definitions
- `src/loot/ItemGenerator.ts` - Integration with drop system
- `src/loot/ItemTypes.ts` - Item type definitions (has uniqueEffect field)

## When Done
Run `bd close pixeloot-qrp --reason="summary"`

title: Add Mage skills: Arcane Wall and Meteor
description: Add 2 missing Mage skills: Arcane Wall (barrier that blocks enemy movement for duration) and Meteor (large AoE after 1.5s delay telegraph, massive damage - commit & payoff skill). Add to Mage.ts skill definitions, integrate with SkillSystem.ts.
notes:
## prepared.prompt

## Context
Mage has 4 of 6 skills. Arcane Wall adds defensive utility (barrier), Meteor adds a high-risk high-reward commit skill with telegraphed AoE.

## Task
Add 2 new skills to `src/entities/classes/Mage.ts`:

1. **Arcane Wall** (Key: configurable, Cooldown: 15s):
   - Places a barrier perpendicular to player-mouse direction at cursor position
   - Wall is ~160px wide, 16px thick
   - Blocks enemy movement (enemies collide with it) for 5s duration
   - Does NOT block projectiles (player or enemy)
   - Visual: glowing purple/blue rectangular barrier with shimmer effect
   - Wall fades out over last 1s of duration
   - Use PixiJS Graphics, add collision body to wall

2. **Meteor** (Key: configurable, Cooldown: 14s):
   - Target location at mouse cursor position
   - 1.5s delay before impact (telegraph phase)
   - Telegraph: growing red/orange circle on ground showing impact zone (96px radius)
   - On impact: 200 damage to all enemies in radius, applies Burn status
   - Screen shake on impact (if screen shake system exists, otherwise skip)
   - Visual: bright orange flash expanding outward, then fading

Follow existing skill pattern in `getSkills()` array using `SkillDef` interface.

## Key Files
- `src/entities/classes/Mage.ts` - Mage class skills
- `src/core/SkillSystem.ts` - Skill definitions
- `src/core/StatusEffects.ts` - For Burn application
- `src/ecs/systems/CombatSystem.ts` - Damage dealing

## When Done
Run `bd close pixeloot-urz --reason="summary"`

title: Monster scaling formula
description: Implement: Monster Level = max(MapBaseLevel, PlayerLevel - 2) + MapTierBonus. Map base level prevents trivializing content. Player-2 keeps monsters slightly below (upgrades feel impactful). Tier bonus (+0 to +5) makes higher maps genuinely harder. Apply to monster HP, damage, and drop quality.

notes:
## prepared.prompt

## Context
The game has 5 zone themes but GDD calls for 8. New zones add visual variety and can influence enemy composition for endgame map diversity.
